alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 6:58PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT MITCHELL...JEWELL...EASTERN SMITH AND EASTERN OSBORNE COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM CDT... At 658 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Burr Oak to 8 miles north of Lucas. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mankato, Cawker City, Glen Elder, Tipton, Burr Oak, Ionia, and Hunter around 705 PM CDT. Jewell around 715 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Webber, Victor, Montrose, Lovewell State Park, Beloit, Formoso and Randall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Hastings. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central Kansas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for north central Kansas.
